alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 19 at 2:46PM MST until August 19 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 315 PM MST. * At 245 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Apache Junction to near Queen Creek to near Magma, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes AZ Route 202 between mile markers 34 and 37, and between mile markers 40 and 44. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Gilbert, Apache Junction, Queen Creek, Chandler Heights, San Tan Valley, and Higley. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
